security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown files with code examples. No executable code, scripts, network calls, file system access, or external command execution. All content is static pattern documentation for the Tamagui UI framework.

content.value_statement: Building consistent web and native interfaces with Tamagui requires understanding compiler optimization, design tokens, and platform-specific patterns. This skill provides expert patterns for config v4, compound components, animations, and accessible overlays.
actual_capabilities: Config v4 setup with createTamagui and createThemes patterns
Compound components using createStyledContext and withStaticProperties
Compiler optimization techniques and escape hatches
Animation drivers for CSS and react-native-reanimated
Dialog, Sheet, Popover, and Select overlay patterns with Adapt
Form patterns with react-hook-form and zod validation
limitations: Does not replace reading official Tamagui documentation for latest API changes
Does not generate complete applications or components from scratch
Does not provide debugging or troubleshooting for Tamagui runtime errors
Does not include pre-built component libraries or design assets

prompt_templates.title: Config setup

prompt_templates.title: Compound component

prompt_templates.title: Overlay pattern

prompt_templates.title: Performance optimization
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my component code and identify patterns that break compiler optimization. Show how to fix dynamic styles and enable full extraction

output_examples.input: Create a compound Button component with size variants and styled text
output: Size variants using '...size' spread operator for token mapping
ButtonText with same context for automatic variant sync

best_practices: Use variants with spread operators ('...size', '...fontSize') instead of inline functions for compiler optimization
Apply animations to Content components (Dialog.Content, Sheet.Frame), never to Portal containers
Use Adapt pattern for touch devices instead of Platform.OS branching in Dialog, Sheet, Popover
anti_patterns: Avoid inline style objects with dynamic values - breaks compiler extraction and optimization
Do not mix React Native StyleSheet with Tamagui tokens - values won't resolve properly
Avoid creating functions in render or spreading unknown props - prevents optimization

faq.question: How does Tamagui handle cross-platform styling?
faq.answer: Tamagui uses Adapt to transform components between platforms. Dialog becomes Sheet on touch devices automatically.

faq.question: What is the compiler optimization benefit?
faq.answer: Static props and variants are extracted at build time to atomic CSS, reducing runtime overhead significantly.

faq.question: How do I create custom themes?
faq.answer: Use createThemes with palette, accent, and childrenThemes for semantic color systems across light and dark modes.

faq.question: Which animation driver should I choose?
faq.answer: CSS driver for web (smallest bundle), react-native-reanimated for native (off-thread animations).

faq.question: How do I prevent form submission issues?
faq.answer: Always wrap submit buttons in Form.Trigger with asChild. Without it, onSubmit will not fire.

faq.question: Can I use Tamagui with design systems like Storybook?
faq.answer: Yes. Document design tokens and component variants in Storybook for team consistency and testing.
